title: How can we change the structure of government to make it focus more on long-term problems that will ruin everything, i.e. climate change? - Quora
tags: Government in the United States of America

response.answer_text: The only way I see for everyone to get involved, make every citizen have a duty to serve in the government making politicians obsolete. Each citizen has a set amount of time to serve in the capacity of the career politicians which would be tied to health care and all government benefits. Then with no real politicians we would have to have a rule somewhere that states that if taking money or anything for a vote would negate all future benefits to that person doing service so that is not desirable.

If you are a citizen of a country where the government is elected, you can exercise your franchise in a way that makes you beliteve that your favoured candidate would have long term solutions to existing conditions that you believe are problems that require such solutions. There is nothing more that you can do as an individual. If you are a citizen of a country governed by a particular political group's decree, there is nothing that you can do unless the ruling group has views similar to yours.
The best way to make change is to become active, follow matters politically, join a political party and have a say. - then vote the bastards out if they do not commit to reasonable politics.
